item.title: Adam add a quote by Howard Waldrop
item.description: "I can't die yet - I haven't seen <i>The Jolson Story</i>!" -- Howard Waldrop

item.title: Adam add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Adam add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "We're always thinking of eternity as an idea that cannot be understood, something immense. But why must it be? What if, instead of all this, you suddenly find just a little room there, something like a village bath-house, grimy, and spiders in every corner, and that's all eternity is. Sometimes, you know, I can't help feeling that that's what it is." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Adam add a quote by H. P. Lovecraft
item.description: "The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind." -- H. P. Lovecraft

item.title: Adam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Adam add a quote by Steve Aylett
item.description: "No matter how good the idea, thereâ€™s always an advocate extreme enough to deter people." -- Steve Aylett

item.title: Adam add a quote by Steve Aylett
item.description: "The optimist sees the future as a rabbit sees the oncoming truck - getting bigger, not closer." -- Steve Aylett

item.title: Adam add a quote by Kyril Bonfiglioli
item.description: "It was still only nine o'clock when I set off on the last leg of my journey, feeling old and dirty and incapable. You probably know the feeling if you are over eighteen. " -- Kyril Bonfiglioli

item.title: Adam add a quote by John Brunner
item.description: "Shit, I forgot. This time of the afternoon the bar's probably shut. Half the staff has gone sick again. Mono, I think. Well, let's go look anyway; we might be lucky. We can't go up to my room--it's full of bugs.' Which kind?' Both." -- John Brunner

item.title: Adam add a quote by John Brunner
item.description: "It's supposed to be automatic, but actually you have to push this button. " -- John Brunner

item.title: Adam add a quote by Bruce Sterling
item.description: "You know what's truly weird about any financial crisis? We made it up. Currency, money, finance, they're all social inventions. When the sun comes up in the morning it's shining on the same physical landscape, all the atoms are in place." -- Bruce Sterling

item.title: Adam add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "Civilised life, you know, is based on a huge number of illusions in which we all collaborate willingly. The trouble is we forget after a while that they are illusions and we are deeply shocked when reality is torn down around us." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Adam add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Adam add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All language is but a poor translation." -- Franz Kafka
